timeline.bodyText: @TobiGr @Stypox Do we really want this license line in every file?
timeline.author: XiangRongLin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,126 @@
+// Created by Fynn Godau 2019, licensed GNU GPL version 3 or later

replies.bodyText: I don't know. I think they should either be in every file of the project or in none. I'd go with the latter since I don't see how they are useful and they are just a burden to maintain up-to-date.
replies.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: When code is not licensed, you are by default not allowed to use it. Therefore, the GNU GPL recommends to explicitly grant the license at the beginning of each file, making it extra clear that you are allowed to use it. Here I kept it extra short so that it only takes one line.
replies.author: fynngodau

replies.bodyText: I'd also keep the license.
replies.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyText: This is not specific to bandcamp is it? Meaning other services could theoretically use it and it should go to ExtractorHelper

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure how well this would transfer to other websites… I don't know whether this is a common way of giving the JavaScript some data, but there are certainly many others as well. Bandcamp also used to do it differently.

timeline.message: Use Collections.emptyList() instead of Collections.EMPTY_LIST or new ArrayList()
Fix potential NPE

Use propper structure in KioskExtractors

Made BandCampRadioExtractor a Kiosk which holds StreamInfoItems and not InfoItems.
Move radio URL check into a function
Code improvements
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/dev' into bandcamp
Add isUploaderVerified()

remove print stacktrace

use interface

remove print stacktrace

use interface
Code improvements
Add BASE_URL and BASE_API_URL to BandcampExtractorHelper
Rename BandcampExtractorHelper.smartConcatenate(String[], String) to Utils.nonEmptyAndNullJoin(String, String[])

Fix Utils.nonEmptyAndNullJoin

When using the index here, it the index needs to be decremented once an element is removed. To cirecumvent this, the native Collections.removeIf() method is used.
Move BandcampExtractorHelper.getJsonData(String, String) to JsonUtils
Merge branch 'dev' into bandcamp
Bandcamp service with support for streams and searches
Return empty kiosk list instead of null
Return mp3-128 audio stream [experimental]
Bandcamp audio stream test and fix
Bandcamp channel link handler factory
Bandcamp channel extractor (ignoring everything but tracks)
Bandcamp channel extractor: enforce https when getting banner url
Bandcmap channel extractor: fix getting banner url
Bandcamp stream extractor: catch NullPointerException
Bandcamp channel extractor: handel nonexistent images better
Add channels (artists) to search results
Add bandcamp playlists (albums)
Various improvements concerning bandcamp playlists
Bandcamp playlist and search extractors: better and more tests
Add bandcamp search suggestion extractor
Bandcamp search: multiple pages
Bandcamp search extractor: read track count from result page
Bandcamp playlist extractor: support playlists with just one stream
Bandcamp featured kiosk

Add bandcamp weekly kiosk

Unfortunately a little messy
Bandcamp radio: proper name, date shortened
Refuse to load bandcamp playlists without content
Refuse to load bandcamp playlists without content

Workaround enourmous load times for long bandcamp playlists

Additionally, get cover art from json instead of html
Add bandcamp to list of supported services in README

Merge branch 'dev' into dev

Merge 'origin/dev' into dev
Change nanojson dependency to @wb9688's fork

timeline.author: wb9688
wb9688

timeline.bodyText: No need for the throws ParsingException then
timeline.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Can't you use for (Object item : jsonArray)?
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText:
No, I can't; it would have to be for (JsonObject item : jsonArray) (because I then want to get a String from this JsonObject) and that is not possible because the Json parser doesn't know of what kind its array is.
This is as if I would replace getObject(i) with get(i), which returns an Object as well, not a JsonObject.
replies.author: fynngodau

replies.bodyText: For YouTube, we do for (Object item : jsonArray) everywhere and just downcast i.e. item to a JsonObject
replies.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: I changed it (9bc7a47); I do think the way I did is cleaner, but there's no need to argue about it…
replies.author: fynngodau

timeline.bodyText: I think you should still just return the actual ID in getId()
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: This would require querying the page, which I think would be better to avoid because the ID is not necessary.
replies.author: fynngodau

timeline.bodyText: There's no need to do this stuff…
timeline.author: wb9688

replies.bodyText: I wrote this because I thought that in order for album URLs to work as IDs, they would always have to look the same, so that asking for the ID of the same URL twice would have to always yield the same result
replies.author: fynngodau

replies.bodyText: YouTube channel IDs also aren't always the same. AFAIK we don't store IDs anywhere in NP, just URLs

replies.bodyText:
I wrote above:

Fan pages
Are extra work because they look different and don't really provide a lot of value I think

A fan page is a collection of items that a user (fan) has bought. It doesn't really make sense to implement them to me, and it might mislead users to think that a fan is the creator of the items in their account.

replies.bodyText: BandcampStreamExtractor is the superclass of BancampRadioStreamExtractor. It implements getUploadDate(), which uses the getTextualUploadDate() method to get the text date and parses it. The code would be the same for BandcampStreamExtractor as well as BancampRadioStreamExtractor, so I did not duplicate it.

replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText:
Setting the locale the US solves the parsing issue.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        final Date date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz", Locale.ENGLISH).parse(textDate);
          
          
            
                        final Calendar calendar = Calendar.getInstance();
          
          
            
                        calendar.setTime(date);
          
          
            
                        return new DateWrapper(calendar, false);
          
          
            
                        final OffsetDateTime offsetDateTime = OffsetDateTime.parse(
          
          
            
                            textDate, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz", Locale.US));
          
          
            
                        return new DateWrapper(offsetDateTime, false);

replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText:
Using ZonedDateTime instead of OffsetDateTime works, and the locale doesn't need to be set to US.
The ZonedDateTime can be converted using toOffsetDateTime().
replies.author: Isira-Seneviratne
